p: Four of six narrative elements were positively associated with article citation frequency ( Fig 1). We obtained similar results when holding the year of publication constant ( S2 and S3 Figs) and when analyzing the same dataset with outliers excluded ( S1 Fig), indicating that neither publication year nor extreme data points substantially affect the trends we report here. Table 1 shows p-values for nonparametric tests (Wilcoxon Rank Sum for binary variables; Spearman correlations for continuous variables), and gives Spearmanâ€™s rho for continuous variables.
